Posts.Content: Dear Jodie, Hope you are doing okay. Thanks for the reply. My onocologist did order more CT scans. She thought that she felt something in my neck and I had a CT scan of my neck, check, and abdomen.  The results showed no DEFINITE metastasis. The neck was clear and the liver showed some type of cyst,but the nodules in the neck were too small to characterize at this time. She says this is good news for now.  I will have them repeated in 6 mos. So, it is still a waiting game.
Posts.Title: Lung nodules on CT scan

Posts.Content: I was originally diagnosed with stage 2B, ER+, Her2Nue + breast cancer less than 2 yrs. ago. I had chemo(Adriamycin and Cytoxin and then Taxol, following by Herceptin for a year. I also had radiation for 6 weeks. I am on Arimidex at this time. I had a CT scan done last week for reasons not pertaining to my cancer (it was actually a coronary artery calcium screening) due to my now having high cholesterol. Anyway, during the CT scan some non-calcified nodules showed up on my lung, along with a small lesion on the liver.  These are small and my internist suggested to me to wait 4 mos and have another CT scan. The lesions were less than 4mm. Just wondering if anyone else has had anything like this show up. I can't help but worry that this is a metastasis and don't know if I should push the issue of further test at this time or if it is safe to wait and see if they are growing?
Posts.Title: Lung nodules on CT scan

Posts.Content: I too am having somewhat of the same problem.  I had long thick hair prior to chemo and now it has grown back but the top is very thin and see-through. I am wondering if it has anything to do with the Arimidex that I am now taking.  Are you taking anything now?
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: I am currentky on Arimidex. I have been on it for a little over a year.  I have had two bone scans done, one at the beginning of my treatment and I recently had another one.  I have had bone loss and I am currently taking Actonel for that.  The Arimidex does cause me to have bone pain and joint pain as well as hot flashes, but they are tolerable.
Posts.Title: Arimidex and Zometa

Posts.Content: Oh my gosh! I could not believe it when I saw that you also had sensations of your body vibrating. I am on Arimedex and also have these feelings.  People look at me like I am crazy when I tell them that it fells like my body is vibrating at night. I could not think of any other way to describe it. Now I know that I am not the only one.  I also have achy muscles and bone pain, bone loss, high cholesterol, hair thinning, swelling of my feet & legs (at times), shall I continue.  I have only been taking this for a little over a year, so I have about 4 more to go, but if it is helping to keep the cancer away I am willing to put up with the side effects. I do sometimes wonder if it is helping or not.
Posts.Title: Side effects of Aromasin and Armidex

Posts.Content: I am also becoming a little discouraged after being on the Aimidex for almost a year.  I was doing okay, some joint and bone pain, but I could deal with it. But now I am struggling. Lots of bone and joint pain, depression, not sleeping at night, etc. Is this going to continue to get worse?  I have no energy, feel like I am 80 years old. I go to work and all I can think about is getting home and going to bed. Do any of you have tingling and numbness in your arms or legs.  This only happens when I am lying down and it is hard to sleep.  Called my doctor and asked about this and was told that it could not be a side effect of Arimidex, but it makes me wonder.
Posts.Title: Side Effects - Arimidex

Posts.Content: I am a two year breast cancer survivor, stage IIB, Estrogen positive, Her2 positive. I just had a CT scan which showed an enlargement of the level 2 internal jugular chain lymph node. Has anyone had this show up on a CT scan? I don't see my onocologist for a week to discuss thses results and was wondering what this might mean.
Posts.Title: Enlarged jugular chain lymph node

Posts.Content: Hi! My name is Donna and I was diagnosed with breast cancer that was also Her2nue +. I was diagnosed in Sept. of 2005 and I started my chemo in Dec. of 2005. Has your doctor mentioned Herceptin. After chemo, I had these treatments for a year. The Herceptin treatments were not bad at all. My doctor told me that before Herceptin that I would have had a bad prognosis, but the Herceptin stops reoccurance in about 50% of pts. I am doing well now and hope that everything turns out well for you. Keep you spirits up (I know it can be hard).
Posts.Title: her2 neu pos and very scared. I need help!

Posts.Content: Deasr Pauline, I know all of this can be overwhelming and scary. We are all afraid of the unknown. What type of chemo are they talking about putting you on.  I had Adriamycin and Cytoxin every three weeks for 4 cycles and then Taxol every week for twelve weeks. The Adriamycin and Cytoxin were harder on me than the Taxol. I did lose all of my hair, including my eyelashes and eyebrows, but they do come back. The medicines that they make for the nausea are very good now. You will feel very tired, but your energy will eventually return. Like I said before. I feel good these days except for some muscle and bone pain that is brought on by the Arimidex that I now take for 5 years. But, this is manageable and if I have to do all of this again I would. I had a port put in for my chemo infusions and this was helpful. If you have any questions about what you are going through or just need someone to vent to feel free to write me here or email me directly. Stay positive and everything will work out.
Posts.Title: her2 neu pos and very scared. I need help!

Posts.Content: Isn't it funny how we all seem to have many of the same symptons, but our doctors always seem to say that " I do not think that this is being caused by the Arimidex ( or any of the other drugs in this cateory)?  I have been on this for a little over a year.  I have the muscle pain, bone pain, tiredness, bone loss, thinning my hair, etc., but I do have to say that if the medicine is helping in any way that I will continue to put up with these side effects. I am willing to do anything to fight.
Posts.Title: Rib pain

Posts.Content: I had bad nerve pain that started near the end of my chemo.  Tell your doctor. There are things that can help you. My doctor prescribed Neurontin and I took it for several months and my nerve pain is now gone. They did not give me my last chemo treatment because she said that she did not want to cause permanent nerve damage.
Posts.Title: nerve pain from chemo 5 months ago?

Posts.Content: I also had numb feet and hands, along with pain, after Taxol. The neuropathy got so bad in my hands that I had to start taking Neurontin. I took this for several months. This pain and numbness did go away after about 4 months.
Posts.Title: numb feet

Posts.Content: Hi! I too have a 25 year old son who became an alcoholic after my diagnosis with cancer. It was a very hard time during my chemo and radiation. He is a sweet bay, but during this time he became uncontrollable and very angry.  He did finally agree to go to rehab. He did very with that, but then turned to pain pills. He has now been to medical detox for the pain pills and is finally becoming the son I used to know. Keep your head up and hopefully your son will come around also.  I am doing well now and I think he is not as scared as he was at first.
Posts.Title: how do i get my son back

Posts.Content: Hi! I am a 2 year survivor. I have stage IIB, estrogen +, HER2NEU + breast cancer. I have been taking Arimidex for one year now and have some side effects, but none so bad that I would stop taking it. My doctor tells me that the benefits outway the side effects for me. I do have joint and bone pain, and my cholesterol is now high. I also get hot flashes, but they are tolerable. Hopefully you side effects will not  be too bad and you will have success with the medication. I wish you much luck.
Posts.Title: Thanks

Posts.Content: I am so sorry to hear about the loss of your friend. I know that she is in a place where there is no more suffering, but that does not lessen the pain that you and her family are feeling now. I am a breast cancer survivor and I also know the pain of losing someone close to breast cancer. I have lost an aunt, a cousin, and a good friend to this disease. I will keep you in my prayers.
Posts.Title: Laura passed away on Saturday

Posts.Content: Hi! I had Herceptin for a year because my cancer was Her2+. I did really well in the Herceptin until right at the end. They did not give me my last treatment because I was having some issues with my heart, but they said that it was reversible heart damage and i am fine now. It has been quite a few months since I stopped the Herceptin. I do think that the good that this medicine can do outweighs the bad. One other question, How did the find your lung nodules. I had a CT scan of my heart the other day and they just happened to pick up 4 small nodules on my lungs. They are telling me to wait 4 months and then have another CT scan. I am not sure that I really want to wait.
Posts.Title: this time herceptin?

Posts.Content: Hi! I had terrible neuropathy in my feet and hands as a result of chemo.  I tried many over the counter products with no help and then my doctor put me on Neurontin.  I took it and it did stop the pain and after a several months my onocologist said that I could gradually stop taking the medication to see if the pain was gone and I can say that I no longer suffer from any type of neuropathy. I also did not have any side effects from this medication.
Posts.Title: Neuropathy in feet

Posts.Content: I also had long thick hair before chemo. I finished my chemo in Feb. of 2007.  My hair is growing, but the top is very thin and you can see my scalp and a wiry texture. The rest of my hair is very curly and full and it looks wierd with the top so thin and the rest thick. My eyelashes came back, but they are a little thinner than they were. I have heard that after time your hair does go back to the way it was. I hope so. I hate it now and I cannot do anything with it. Good luck with you hair regrowth.
Posts.Title: hair regrowth after chemo
